result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jesse A. KLEIN was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to the sentence imposed on 13 CF 272.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Submit to DNA sample and surcharge.

Submit to Court Order for Intoxicated Driver Assessment And Driver Safety Plan.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse A. KLEIN

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
The defendant has successfully completed the Earned Release Program as of 08-14-15.
It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from confinement to extended supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in confinement and changing the remaining confinement to extended supervision.  The number of days that are converted from confinement time to extended supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.
It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.
Cover letter.

Transcript of plea and sentencing hearing  held on 04-08-14.
Original transcript is on file in case no: 13 CF 272.
Copy of transcript delivered to Registrar along with defendant.

NO CONTEST plea to count 1, OWI (6th). Convicted.
The Court dismisses and reads in Counts 2 through 8.
Defendant is sentenced to the Wisconsin State Prison System for a total of thirty-six (36) months. That is twelve (18) months initial confinement followed by eighteen (18) months extended supervision, to run consecutive to sentence in Case No. 13CF272.
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.
Defendant has credit for 55 days.
Conditions of extended supervision:
1) Pay a fine of $1,800.00 ($600.00 x 3) plus costs, total $3,289.00;            
2) Maintain absolute sobriety;
3) Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Departments assessment process;  
4) AODA assessment and follow through including the Court Order for Intoxicated Driver Assessment And Driver Safety Plan;          
5) Maintain fulltime employment and/or schooling;
6) Pay Supervision Fees in amount to be determined by DOC;
7) Provide DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge;
Thirty-six (36) month DL revocation and thirty-six (36) month period of Ignition Interlock.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 02-26-14 at 2:00 p.m.
Minutes.
Blood Search Warrant - Section 968.12, Wisconsin Statutes; Affidavit of Officer Nicholas Place, in Support of Blood Search Warrant; Return of Search Warrant.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of OWI - 5th or 6th offense and bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-17-14 at 2:30 p.m.   Bail is set at $2,000.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, that he maintain absolute sobriety and that he not operate a motor vehicle.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
